title: Ryuga Hideki
author: Ryuga Hideki
content: What's the average salary in Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia, Libia and Egypt?We are looking for a country to open a small company for data entry with 10 employees.Can you help me guys? I'm looking for some infos.What about, other than the average salary for a data entry job, rent prices? And is it safe to have an office with 10 300€ worth PCs?

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Quote from: Ryuga Hideki on February 26, 2023, 05:29:00 PMWhat's the average salary in Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia, Libia and Egypt?We are looking for a country to open a small company for data entry with 10 employees.Can you help me guys? I'm looking for some infos.What about, other than the average salary for a data entry job, rent prices? And is it safe to have an office with 10 300€ worth PCs?Average salaries vary from country to country and according to the type of job.  But in general, the average cannot be considered a large amount by calculating the value of the local currency with the dollar.  As for opening a service company, I recommend one of the two countries, Morocco or Tunisia, since they have a high demand for crypto adoption, and it will be easy to find employees, and their salaries can also be paid from abroad using Bitcoin or any of the cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: Kavelj22 on February 26, 2023, 06:05:21 PM[ I recommend one of the two countries, Morocco or Tunisia, since they have a high demand for crypto adoption, and it will be easy to find employees.I think the demand for or interest in crypto has nothing to do with finding the best place for OP's business, they are looking for data entry employees not blockchain related, I do not want to hurt anybody's feelings but I'd pick Egypt simply for the following reason.1- The pay rate is probably the lowest.2- The population is more than the other listed countries combined and thus the manpower is a lot higher.3- The country is pretty safe to a reasonable degree.Some of the other countries you mentioned have some of those points in place too, tax in Alegria and Libya are probably the lowest, and starting a business is perhaps easier in Morocco than in Tunisia or Algeria, but overall I think Egypt would be the best.By the way, why not hire people online instead of having to open up an office and all that?

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Quote from: mikeywith on March 01, 2023, 10:21:17 PMQuote from: Kavelj22 on February 26, 2023, 06:05:21 PM[ I recommend one of the two countries, Morocco or Tunisia, since they have a high demand for crypto adoption, and it will be easy to find employees.I think the demand for or interest in crypto has nothing to do with finding the best place for OP's business, they are looking for data entry employees not blockchain related, I do not want to hurt anybody's feelings but I'd pick Egypt simply for the following reason.Of course, I did not miss all these points, but the owner of the topic publishes his question in a forum specialized in digital currencies, and I assumed that he might have thought of using crypto to pay employees and project costs.Quote from: mikeywith on March 01, 2023, 10:21:17 PMBy the way, why not hire people online instead of having to open up an office and all that? I thought the same point but maybe he wants all procedures to be legal since he may not have enough time to supervise the work.
